The gnome-meta packages don't get much love in Ubuntu. That breakage was a known bug; I generally recommend installing gnome-desktop-environment instead and installing any extra packages you want on top of that manually.
(generally, Ubuntu people go with ubuntu-desktop rather than the Gnome packages)
the "gnome" package likely wouldn't install development headers anyway. If you tell me which library it's complaining about missing, I can point you to a specific package.
Ubuntu Server 8.04 is supported for five years, so until 2013...
is there a package ending in -dev with a similar name? That's probably what it actually wants.
as I've said, it probably needs a package with a similar name with -dev on the end, not the package it's listing
Server 8.04 is supported until 2013. If five years isn't a long enough support period for you, you're using the wrong distro.

Considering that 8.04 to 10.04 upgrades were tested extensively by the QA team, that would count as a bug, which you should either file or provide logs from. We can't help you if you don't do either.
